text: Gary Thorne (born June 9, 1948, in Bangor, Maine) is an American sportscaster. He works with MASN calling games for the Baltimore Orioles. He also calls Little League World Series games for ABC and ESPN and some Major League Baseball games for ESPN. His other jobs include: Sport Covered network Job Baseball Maine Guides play-by-play Baseball New York Mets play-by-play Baseball Chicago White Sox play-by-play Baseball MLB ABC back-up play-by-play Baseball MLB ESPN Radio lead play-by-play Baseball College Baseball ESPN play- by-play Hockey Maine Black Bears play-by-play Hockey New Jersey Devils play- by-play Hockey NHL SportsChannel America play-by-play Hockey NHL ABC, ESPN lead play-by-play Hockey World Junior Hockey NHL Network lead play-by-play Hockey College hockey ESPN lead play-by-play Hockey 2002 Winter Olympics NBC play-by-play Bowling PBA ESPN play-by-play Football College football CBS Sports Network, ABC, ESPN play-by-play Basketball College basketball CBS, ABC, ESPN play-by-play Category:National Hockey League broadcasters Category:Bowling broadcasters Category:Sportspeople from Maine Category:College football broadcasters Category:Major League Baseball broadcasters Category:College basketball broadcasters Category:Living people Category:1948 births Category:People from Bangor, Maine
title: Gary Thorne
